abstract.p: New York Liberty are set to face Sacramento Monarchs at Madison Square Garden (S)

block.p: The Liberty (2-3) returns to Madison Square Garden tonight for a 7 p.m. tip-off against the Sacramento Monarchs, a team that was touted to contest the Houston Comets for the Women's National Basketball Association championship this season. Despite boasting the league's reigning most valuable player, Yolanda Griffith, and the flashy point guard Ticha Penicheiro, the Monarchs (1-3) have lost three straight games after defeating expansion Seattle in the home opener. The Olympic guard Ruthie Bolton-Holifield has missed the last two games with a sprained right knee and is day to day. The Liberty is also hobbling, but nonetheless was able to take home a 73-69 victory at Detroit on Wednesday night. Tari Phillips, a 6-1 center, acquired from Portland in a trade for Carolyn Young, scored 20 points and grabbed 10 rebounds.
